Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Issue #862 solution without webpack 2" (#1799) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Issue #862 fix a problem on lazy load with webpack 2 ,
but I just use the RequireJS  VueJs 2.0   ES5 .
How can I fix this problem ?
Did this has any other solutions ?
(PS: Problem description the same as Issue #1074)

### What does the proposed API look like?
I hope the problem doesn't just be fix on the Third plugin .
I wish it be fixed in vue-router .
That's all thanks .

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Errors in lazy loaded components are not propagated and have no source map support" (#1798) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.7.0

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/176k2vp03](https://codesandbox.io/s/176k2vp03)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Run the codesandbox.io link.
2. Notice that the component isn't rendered.
3. Look at the console to see the unhandled error. 
4. In SSR and on the browser, this error isn't propagated to the usual error handler. In SSR I tested with `renderToString`
5. In SSR the error does not use source maps and is very difficult to debug.

## More info

When using [VUE Router Lazy Loading](https://router.vuejs.org/en/advanced/lazy-loading.html), and there's an error outside of the component, the error is not propagated & the stack trace isn't cleaned up with source maps. Here's the gist of the minimal reproduction (linked):

e.g.  `MyComponent.vue`
```vue
<script>
throw new Error('bad_error');

export default {
  name: 'MyComponent'
};
</script>
```

`createRouter.js`
```js
const MyComponent = () => import('./MyComponent.vue');

export default createRouter() {
  return new Router({
    routes: [
      { path: '/', component: MyComponent }
    ]
  });
}
```

Error in the logs:
```
[vue-router] Failed to resolve async component default: Error: bad_error
[vue-router] uncaught error during route navigation:
 Error: bad_error
     at Object.exports.modules.Array.concat.Object.defineProperty.value (0.server-bundle.js:12842:7)
     at __webpack_require__ (server-bundle.js:27:30)
    at Object.<anonymous> (0.server-bundle.js:12708:141)
     at __webpack_require__ (server-bundle.js:27:30)
     at Object.exports.modules.Array.concat.Object.de
```

### What is expected?
I expect the error to be propagated to the `renderToString` err in the callback and the error to be rewritten using the source maps.

### What is actually happening?
When rendered with SSR, the page hangs, as the error is never propagated to `renderToString`'s `err` in the callback.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "lazing loading doc err" (#1797) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vue-router

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.
-->
the code in [lazing-loading document](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/dev/docs/zh-cn/advanced/lazy-loading.md) doesnt work
```javascript
const Foo = () => import('./Foo.vue')
```
it works as actually
```javascript
const Foo = (resolve)=> {
       import('./Foo.vue').then((component)=>{resolve(component)})
    }
```
and [webpack](https://webpack.js.org/api/module-methods/#import-) provide comments parameters since 2.6.0 not 2.4.0.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "lazing loading doc err" (#1797) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vue-router

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.
-->
the code in [lazing-loading document](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/dev/docs/zh-cn/advanced/lazy-loading.md) doesnt work
```javascript
const Foo = () => import('./Foo.vue')
```
it works as actually
```javascript
const Foo = (resolve)=> {
       import('./Foo.vue').then((component)=>{resolve(component)})
    }
```
and [webpack](https://webpack.js.org/api/module-methods/#import-) provide comments parameters since 2.6.0 not 2.4.0.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue " $router.go(-1)在safari reading-list下bug" (#1796) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
重现步骤：

有两个页面，并且将http:///127.0.0.1/user/a  添加到收藏夹中。

1.   /a 中有个按钮 “GO” ，点击跳转到 /b    ， /b中有个“返回”按钮，执行 $router.go(-1) 方法，返回到/a页面
2.  在收藏夹中打开/a 页面， 点击GO跳转，在/b中返回的时候就变成空白的页面了。
选项卡显示是：reading-list://


有遇到这个问题的么？如何解决呢？

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "beforeEnter logout localStorage.clear() no use" (#1794) at vuejs/vue-router
Closed issue "mapState does not work with modules" (#983) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.4.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/mallendeo/pen/PJevYg](https://codepen.io/mallendeo/pen/PJevYg)

### Steps to reproduce
Nothing, the bug is happening in the first Vue instance.

### What is expected?
isRecording should be true in the first instance.

### What is actually happening?
mapState is not mapping the `recording` module state.
Since it's a non-namespaced module, state should be accessible on the global scope, just like actions and getters.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
